description: Basswood is a soft, light wood often used in craft and hobby projects.
short desc: Basswood is a soft, light wood often used in craft and hobby projects.
source: Samples cut from 19 mm thick, 0.1 m x 0.61 m board.

measured property.test name: heat release rate per unit area
measured property.test description: Experiments for heat release per unit area [kW/m<sup>2</sup>] were conducted on samples conditioned at 25°C and 50% relative humidity using a cone calorimeter at three different heat fluxes: 25 kW/m<sup>2</sup>, 50 kW/m<sup>2</sup>, and 75 kW/m<sup>2</sup>.\nThis material warps into an arched shape during the fire's decay phase. This was observed in the first test (HF25_R1) and prevented in all subsequent tests by the use of tie wires.

Mass loss rate [kg/s] was measured in the simultaneous thermal analyzer experiments at three heating rates: 3 K/min, 10 K/min, and 30 K/min and cone calorimeter experiments at three heat fluxes: 25 kW/m<sup>2</sup>, 50 kW/m<sup>2</sup>, and 75 kW/m<sup>2</sup>.\nIn cone calorimeter tests, this material warps into an arched shape during the fire's decay phase. This was observed in the first test (HF25_R1) and prevented in all subsequent tests by the use of tie wires.

Carbon monoxide yield was measured during cone calorimeter experiments conducted at heat fluxes of 25 kW/m<sup>2</sup>, 50 kW/m<sup>2</sup>, and 75 kW/m<sup>2</sup>.\nThis material warps into an arched shape during the fire's decay phase. This was observed in the first test (HF25_R1) and prevented in all subsequent tests by the use of tie wires.

derived property.test description: Effective heat of combustion [MJ/kg] is calculated from data collected in micro-scale combustion calorimeter experiments.
